text.p: Australia's second largest metal recycling company, Metalcorp Ltd, said on Tuesday that it had offered to acquire Queensland metals recycling company Wanless Metal Industries Pty Ltd.
Metalcorp said it would probably fund the acquisition from existing cash resources and from the issue of ordinary shares in Metalcorp, subject to shareholder approval.
Wanless employs about 80 people and its operations include ferrous and non-ferrous recycling and some steel merchandising from eight sites in Queensland.
Metalcorp's company secretary, Brian Milton, said the acquisition was subject to a first right of refusal clause held by rival recycler Simsmetal ltd.

However, even if Simsmetal decided to acquire Wanless, it could face difficulties in gaining approval from the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission to proceed with the acquisition, Milton told Reuters.
"Right now its really wait and see," Milton said.
